A set of mathematical functions and algorithms.

  • Method Details

    • min

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_, _ -> new") public static <T extends Number> T min​(T a, T b)
      Returns the smaller of two numeric values. If the arguments have the same value, the result is that same value. If either value is NaN, then the result is also NaN. If exactly one of the arguments is null, the result is the other argument, whereas if both values are null, then the result is also null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the number class
      Parameters:
      a - first operand
      b - second operand
      Returns:
      the smaller of a and b

    • max

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_, _ -> new") public static <T extends Number> T max​(T a, T b)
      Returns the bigger of two numeric values. If the arguments have the same value, the result is that same value. If either value is NaN, then the result is also NaN. If exactly one of the arguments is null, the result is the other argument, whereas if both values are null, then the result is also null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the number class
      Parameters:
      a - first operand
      b - second operand
      Returns:
      the bigger of a and b

    • degToRad

      @Contract(pure=true) public static float degToRad​(float angle)
      Converts an angle value in degrees to a value in radians. Unlike Math.toRadians(double), this method operates on float values.
      Parameters:
      angle - an angle value in degrees
      Returns:
      the specified angle in radians

    • radToDeg

      @Contract(pure=true) public static float radToDeg​(float angle)
      Converts an angle value in radians to a value in degrees. Unlike Math.toDegrees(double), this method operates on float values.
      Parameters:
      angle - an angle value in radians
      Returns:
      the specified angle in degrees

    • probability

      @Contract(pure=true) public static boolean probability​(float probability)
      Returns true with given probability using the Random pseudorandom-number generator.
      Parameters:
      probability - the probability that returned value is true
      Returns:
      true with the probability of the parameter value

    • combineTransforms

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") public static org.jsfml.graphics.Transform combineTransforms​(@NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.graphics.Transform... transforms)
      Combines transformation matrices by multiplying them.
      Parameters:
      transforms - the transformation matrices
      Returns:
      the product of the specified matrices

    • taxicabDistance

      public static int taxicabDistance​(org.jsfml.system.Vector2i a, org.jsfml.system.Vector2i b)
      Returns the taxicab (Manhattan geometry) distance between two points, which is the result of the following expression: Math.abs(a.x - b.x) + Math.abs(a.x - b.y)
      Parameters:
      a - first point
      b - second point
      Returns:
      the taxicab distance between the points

    • direction

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true, value="_, _ -> new") public static @NotNull org.jsfml.system.Vector2f direction​(@NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.system.Vector2f origin, @NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.system.Vector2f target)
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin point
      target - the target point
      Returns:
      the direction unit vector (normalzed) from the origin to the target point, or Vector2f.ZERO if the specified points have the same coordinates

    • collisionDirection

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true, value="_, _, _ -> new") public static @NotNull org.jsfml.system.Vector2f collisionDirection​(@NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.graphics.CircleShape circle, @NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.system.Vector2f circleDirection, @NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.graphics.RectangleShape rectangle)
      Parameters:
      circle - a circle shape
      circleDirection - the circle shape's moving direction
      rectangle - a rectangle shape
      Returns:
      the new circle's direction vector moving in the direction of circleDirection if it collides with rectangle, or the current circle's direction vector otherwise
